question: Is this a block banner?
answer: If there are multiple in block banners containing and tags, this is a block banner.
logic: Check if there are multiple items in that block?. Create a variable to store the banner location with a random name, for example: BANNER_HOME.. If there are multiple items in that block, define variable: {% set banner_home = getBannerByPositionCode('BANNER_HOME') %}, If there is only one item in that block, define variable: {% set banner_home = getCurrentBannerByCode('BANNER_HOME', {'limit':1}) %}. Check if the declared banner is not empty then render HTML

question: How to display banner list?
answer: Use the loop to render the list banner
logic: In a banner there are the following attributes: viewLink, target, imageSrc, name, description, intro. Use {% for b in banner_home %} to loop through each banner. The banner attributes correspond to the tags described above (If tag set: href = {{ b.viewLink }}, target = {{ b.target }}, aria-label must be {{ b.name }}, title must be {{ b.name }}. If tag: set src = {{ b.imageSrc }}, alt must be {{ b.name }})

question: Is this a block products list?
answer: If there are multiple block products containing: , ,
logic: Check if it is a product block, will create a variable to call the function to get the product list, for example: {% set newProduct = searchProducts({'limit':10}) %}. Variable 'newProduct' automatically generate block product

question: How to display products list?
answer: Use the loop to render the list products
logic: In a product there are the following attributes: id, productUnit, code, price, oldPrice, contactPrice, priceAfterDiscount, calcDiscountPercent, viewLink, imageUri, typeId. Use {% for p in newProduct%} to loop through each product. The product attributes correspond to the tags described above (If the tag is set: href = {{ p.viewLink }}, aria-label must be {{ p.name }}, title must be {{ p.name }}, create attribute data-id must be {{ p.id }}. If the tag is set: src = {{ p.imageUri }}, alt must be {{ p.name }}). If the percent sign is set, it must be {{ p.calcDiscountPercent }}%. If the price is in the tag then it is the old price {{ p.oldPrice }}, if the price is in the tag then it is the price of the product {{ p.price }}.
